title: Disturbing footage shows tourists running riot in all-in scuffle in Bali streets
text:
Disturbing footage has emerged showing a massive street brawl involving tourists in Bali.

The violent fight, in which at least 10 large men exchanged blows, is believed to have happened in Kuta this week.

Footage, which was filmed by an onlooker, shows a man attempting to separate two men before they push past him and start exchanging blows.

As one of the men falls to the ground others jump in and chaos ensues.

Disturbing footage has emerged showing a massive street bawl involving tourists in Bali

The groups start throwing punches at each other.

Screams can be heard from onlookers as multiple tourists are thrown to the ground during the all-in brawl.

While one of the attackers lays on the ground another man can be seen attempting to stomp on his head.

A large crowd can be seen gathered in the streets, blocking awaiting traffic while the men throw down.

Taxis can be heard honking their horns in an attempt to push through.

The footage comes just days after Melbourne Storm star Nelson Asofa-Solomona allegedly unleashed a barrage of punches outside a nightclub in Bali.

Footage of the violent brawl involving the 23-year-old outside the La Favela bar in Seminyak went viral on Sunday night, sparking questions from the NRL integrity unit.

The violent fight involving at least 10 large men is believed to have happened in a busy street in Kuta this week

Witnesses claim Asofa-Solomona only retaliated when Storm winger Suliasi Vunivalu was hit in the face in an unprovoked attack inside the club.

Bystanders were forced to scatter away from the brawl as the men raged across the street.

A second Melbourne Storm star was also seen laying a massive hit on a punter in the pool of a popular Bali bar hours before the wild brawl that landed Asofa-Solomona in hot water.

Tui Kamikamica lined up the partygoer and crash tackled him into the pool at leading night spot Mrs Sippy on Sunday afternoon, as a crowd of onlookers cheered him on.

A video posted to social media shows the towering Storm prop delivering the big hit before the man - a willing participant in the stunt - emerges from the water, hands in the air in celebration.
